content.description: This route heads up the face right of Amanda's Arete. Friction moves and thin crimps etc on flaky granite. Will become easier with subsequent ascents. About 5.10c during first ascent.
content.protection: Anchor in vertical crack above, pieces about #1 C4 in size. Bring long webbing for anchor. Easy class 3-4ish walk to and from anchors from south side of crag.
content.location: This is the southeastern edge of the crag, up the flaky face to the right of Amanda's Arete.

climbs.name: Mummydick
climbs.fa: A member of Potat's inner circle

content.description: Real cool balancey moves. For what it's worth, the funnest way to do it is to follow the marble sized quartz crystals sticking out. They make for cool moves. This is my favorite line up the Scab Slab.
content.protection: You have your choice for anchors on this one. Atop the crag, there are two cracks. For Amanda's Arete and Slab Jesus, you should use the handcrack. There is a crack right of that which takes small cams. This one may or may not suit your style. Either way, bring about 10-20ft of webbing or so to bring the master point over the edge. Pad the edge with a bag or something. Right side crack takes .4 C4 or so and smaller. I believe I used an X4 and two WC Zeroes.
content.location: This route goes up right of Gnardawg Shredbro, the orange stain running down the rock.

content.description: Good sometimes thin and sometimes a bit crumbly. Small feet. Will be easier upon subsequent ascents. Real good route. Not much else to say. SHRED THE GNAR, BROSEPH! Send this route! Send it wherever you can afford to!!! It's pretty heavy so you'll probably need to send it by rail or something.
content.protection: You have your choice for anchors on this one. Atop the crag, there are two cracks. For Amanda's Arete and Slab Jesus, you should use the handcrack. There is a crack right of that which takes small cams. This one may or may not suit your style. Either way, bring about 10-20ft of webbing or so to bring the master point over the edge. Pad the edge with a bag or something. Right side crack takes .4 C4 or so and smaller. I believe I used an X4 and two WC Zeroes.
content.location: This goes up the obvious orange streak, lefthand side of crag.

content.description: This is a very fun, short route up the left edge of the crag when looking south. Slippery new granite down low with super solid easy moves above. Real fun climb.
content.protection: Anchor in vertical crack above, pieces about #1 C4 in size. Bring long webbing for anchor. Easy class 3-4ish walk to and from anchors from south side of crag.
content.location: This is the southeastern edge of the crag, up the obvious arete.
